aWLI_StateProvision.content: III. PAYMENT OF INSURANCE INDEMNITY 20. Calculation of Insurance Indemnity In case of the Event of Death of the Insured occurring during time when the Insurance Cover is in force, except where the death is a result of any of the causes set out in clause 21 of the Terms and Conditions, the Insurer shall pay Page 2 of 2 1373T,1.3 01.01.2010 the Beneficiary the Insurance Indemnity considering amount of the Sum Insured in force on the day when the Insured Event occurred. 21. Exceptions 21.1. The Insurance Indemnity shall not be paid if the death of the Insured is related to the following circumstances: 21.1.1. Suicide by the Insured within 2 years following the effective date of the Insurance Contract 21.1.2. driving by the Insured while intoxicated with alcohol, narcotic, psychotropic or other intoxicant substances if concentration thereof in the body exceeds the concentration permitted by laws of the country where the accident happened; 21.1.3. nuclear accident, weapons of mass destruction, warfare, the Insured's participation in mass riots or military operations (military training will not be considered as military operations); 21.1.4. intentional criminal offence by the Insured or the Beneficiary as evidenced by investigation and/or judicial documents; 21.1.5. If the death of the Insured occurs due to illness within one year of the Insurance Contract coming into force. 22. Procedure for Payout of Insurance Indemnity 22.1. The Beneficiary shall have a duty to advise the Insurer of the death of the Insured Person as soon as the Beneficiary becomes aware thereof. Where the Beneficiary is a minor, the duty to advise the Insurer shall lie with the Guardia n of the Beneficiary. 22.2. In order for the Insurer to cause payout of the Insurance Indemnity in the Event of Death of the Insured, the Beneficiary, in person or through third parties, shall file a relevant application and the following documents with the In surer: - a copy of passport or other proof of identity (having produced the original documents); - a copy of Insurance Policy where requested so by the Insurer; - a copy of certificate of inheritance by the presentation of original document (if the documents are filed by the inheritor of the Beneficiary); - copy of certificate of death of the Insured (having produced the original document); - a report on the cause of death; - a copy of medical history of the Insured where requested so by the Insurer. - in case of the Insured's violent death, suicide, sudden death or death resulting from an accident, a decision from investigation institutions and / or court documents and/or forensic medicine expert's or commission's formal opinion on the causes and conditions of death. 22.3. The Insurer shall decide on payout of the Insurance Indemnity within 5 (five) business days of receiving all the documents required under the Insurance Contract. The Insurer shall have the right to extend the above period if o bjective reasons to do so exist. The Insurer shall not be obliged to pay out any Insurance Indemnity until and unless information about the death of Insured and the necessary documents are provided. In case the Beneficiary or their Guardian deliberately violates their duti es and fails to advise the Insurer of the death of the Insured, or deliberately does not supply the documents listed in clause 22.1 of the Terms and Conditions, the Insurer shall have no obligation to pay out the Insurance Indemnity. 22.4. If the performance of insurer's obligations, or the extent thereof, depends on the circumstances, which are found in civil, criminal or administrative proceedings or in the proceedings for breach of administrative law, the Insurer will be entitled t o decide on the payment or refusal of insurance indemnity after the suspension, termination of the proceeding or after the decision of the court or appropriate officials comes into force. 22.5. In case of concurrent death of the Insured and of the Beneficiary or if the death of the Beneficiary occurs after the death of the Insured and before payout of the Insurance Indemnity, then, pursuant to the Insurance Contract, the entitlement to receive the Insurance Indemnity shall pass to the heirs of the Beneficiary, who shall be required to present the certificate of inheritance unless the Insurance Contract stipulates otherwise.
